content: ten studio © 2023 finishing bind off in pattern when work is desired length cut yarn leaving an 8 tail with a tapestry needle carefully weave in ends on the wrong side block finished blanket if desired click here to see blocking tips on my website fiftyfourtenstudio com size modifications for wider blanket increase number of stitches cast on in sets of 6 adding 6 stitches will increase width by about 3 for a smaller blanket decrease number of stitches in sets of 6 or calculate the number of stitches 3 x any odd number = number of stitches to cast on for a longer blanket simply knit additional row as desired or until you run out of yarn you may bind off on any row be sure to purchase additional yarn for a larger blanket approximate yardage needed for each additional 2 in length for each blanket size baby 24 - 25 yards large 38 - 40 yards small 30 - 31 yards xl 42 - 44 yards medium 32 - 34 yards xxl 47 - 50 yards need extra help sometimes knitters have challenges getting on track with this pattern if you need assistance see my free tutorial that addresses the most common questions click here to download my *free* boulevard blanket tutorial if you have any questions contact mary lee at fiftyfourtenstudio@gmail com click link below to visit my website and shop my knitting patterns fiftyfourtenstudio com shop all of my knitting patterns on ravelry bit ly/5410studioravelry most of my knitting patterns are available on loveknitting and etsy follow me on facebook and instagram @fiftyfourtenstudio share your project on instagram with tags @fiftyfourtenstudio #fiftyfourtenstudio all content and photographs are the property of fifty four ten studio and may not be used without express permission pattern may not be resold copied or redistributed for any reason via hard copy email or internet posting this pattern may be used for personal use charity knitting or small scale craft sales this pdf document contains affiliate links which do not result in a higher price to the customer 3 the boulevard blanket - knitting pattern design by fifty four ten studio © 2023 it s reversible the boulevard blanket looks exactly the same on both sides inspiration for pattern name the subtle stripes of the boulevard blanket remind me of the beautiful streets in kansas city… my hometown an old promotional slogan for kansas city proclaimed more boulevards than paris more fountains than rome i can t confirm if either of these statements are accurate but the tree lined boulevards as well as the fountains are special features of my hometown i hope you enjoy using this pattern see my other knitting patterns at fiftyfourtenstudio com 4
